abstract.p: Correction of Oct 3 article on Christopher Rocancourt, which misspelled surname and misstated nationality of painter he boasted of knowing

block.p: An article on Tuesday about Christopher Rocancourt, who is sought by authorities on suspicion of having bilked the well-to-do out of millions of dollars by impersonating a Rockefeller, misspelled the surname and misstated the nationality of a painter whose work he boasted of knowing. The painter was Camille Pissarro, not Pissaro. Although born in the Danish West Indies, Pissarro moved to France and was considered French; he was not Spanish.

An article on Tuesday about Christopher Rocancourt, who is sought by authorities on suspicion of having bilked the well-to-do out of millions of dollars by impersonating a Rockefeller, misspelled the surname and misstated the nationality of a painter whose work he boasted of knowing. The painter was Camille Pissarro, not Pissaro. Although born in the Danish West Indies, Pissarro moved to France and was considered French; he was not Spanish.
